text: Hey everyone and welcome to this week's
news and community spotlights. The Epic
Mega Grants is a program that invests in
promising new projects from our
community as they push real-time 3D
development to new heights. And the
second cycle of applications for 2025 is
now open. The submission window for this
round of applications goes from July
14th to September 22nd. So if you're
looking to apply within this cycle, make
sure to mark that date on your calendar.
Smart Spatial is revolutionizing the
creation and operation of complex
commercial digital twins by integrating
technologies like Unreal Engine, IoT,
and Pixel Streaming, allowing developers
to see through digital wars for enhanced
spatial awareness. This breakthrough is
particularly impactful for their current
project with an Ethiopian infrastructure
operator where they're modernizing the
railway system by equipping every train
with sensors. To learn more about how
Smart Spatial utilizes Unreal Engine for
this innovative project, visit unrealeng
engine.com/feed.
Switching game engines can be a daunting
challenge for developers due to
differences in architecture, code
styling, and tools. To ease this
transition for those moving to Unreal
Engine, Epic Games teamed up with Secret
Dimension to create the pirate game
sample. This charming pirate themed 2.5D
platformer was developed in both Unreal
Engine 5.6 6 and Unity 6, ensuring
maximum parity and valuable insights for
developers. The project complete with
full documentation and annotations is
available for free on Fab. For more
insights from the creators, check out
our interview on the feed.
Let's take a look at this week's
incredible community spotlights. In a
stunning display of creativity, Anna
Numova's Forest Elf Warrior combines
elegance, strength, and fantasy into a
breathtaking character design. This
project, born from personal inspiration,
showcases high poly sculpting, realistic
hair, and intricate materials, all
rendered in Unreal Engine 5. Each
detail, from armor to expression, is
meticulously crafted, highlighting a
rich pipeline that includes tools like
ZBrush, marvelous designer, and
substance painter. The final result is a
captivating elf that feels like it
jumped right out of an epic tale. To see
more of Anna's incredible work, visit
her art station.
Set in a vibrant handpainted world, this
charming game demo from Capslocks Games
showcases the enchanting journey of
Leah, a curious young girl exploring the
myths of her hometown, the mysterious
city of Essua. Inspired by the cozy
aesthetics of titles like Project Dragon
and Palia, the project reflects the
team's dedication to whimsical
storytelling and stylized artistry. With
its lush visuals and magical atmosphere,
this graduation project celebrates
exploration and the joy of gaming. Don't
miss the chance to check out the full
game demo.
During the summer Gamef Fest 2025, one
standout reveal was Into the Unwell by
She Was Such a Good Horse. This game
invites you to explore a unique rubber
hose world, either solo or with up to
two friends, as you meet strange
inhabitants and embark on a spirit quest
for self-control while battling bizarre
bosses and quirky characters. The game
stylized graphics left a lasting
impression, so don't forget to show your
support and wish list into the Unwell on
Steam.
That's it for this week's news and
community spotlights. Thank you so much
for watching, and I'll catch you next
time.
